intro: Moehringia lateriflora var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf moehringia, is a flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of white to pink flowers along the stem, typically blooming in early summer. It is native to the western United States and thrives in moist, rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive component of alpine and subalpine ecosystems.
